sentence: W.W. Grainger, Inc.GWW revealed, on Jun 2 its IT security team discovered that the company was the subject of a cyberattack.
However, the intruders could only access limited data on Grainger's network and there is no evidence of any valuable information being compromised.
Grainger shares fell 2% on the news.
In response, Grainger initiated its cybersecurity protocol by notifying law enforcement officials and collaborating with leading cybersecurity experts to investigate the breach.
The company has also taken steps to implement enhanced security measures to prevent such occurrences in the future.
Grainger has not experienced any service disruptions or outages.
The initial phase of this ongoing investigation is complete.

Following which, Grainger stated that there has not been any impact on customers, suppliers or employees as there is no indication that information such as social security numbers or government identification numbers, banking information or credit or debit card information have been compromised by this incident.
However, as a precautionary step, Grainger is offering 12 months of complimentary identity protection services to customers and employees.
Cyberattacks occur frequently nowadays and are becoming an ever-increasing threat.
The number of cyberattacks on large companies rose by 40% last year.

One of the massive cyber attacks reported last year was that of Sony Corporation's SNE American subsidiary, Sony Pictures Entertainment, whose internal data was hacked and valuable information related to upcoming movies and employees pay were stolen.
Among other companies, Staples, Inc. SPLS , The Home Depot, Inc. HD and JPMorgan Chase & Co. have also been the subject of cyberattacks.

While the retailers had reported that hackers broke into their network and compromised consumers' credit card information, in the JPMorgan attack, the bank found no evidence of any fraud or misuse of customer information.
JPMorgan stated the hackers only got access to customer email addresses, home addresses and phone numbers but nothing of a more sensitive nature like Social Security numbers.
Regarding Grainger, it remains to be seen what surfaces after the final investigation.

Lake Forest, IL-based Grainger is a leading North American distributor of material handling equipment, safety and security supplies, lighting and electrical products, power and hand tools, pumps and plumbing supplies, cleaning and maintenance supplies, forestry and agriculture equipment, building and home inspection supplies, vehicle and fleet components, and various aftermarket components.
